intro: Dicoma galpinii, commonly known as the Galpin's dicoma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. Dicoma galpinii is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
